page.title: 08TRADE
page.content: {HISTORY:}In 1890{SAMUEL RODDA}started the Creamery.The business began in a small building which was part of the old farmhouse.When{SAMUEL RODDA}died his son{ALFRED RODDA}took over. {BUSINESS TODAY:}Today the cream is made in a big modern building with lots of special machines.Since 1981 when{RODDAS}sent cream for the royal wedding breakfast,{H.R.H}the{Queen {Mother}and{H.R.H Queen Elizabeth}have received cream every Monday.The{ {Creamery}makes the cream on Wednesday,packs it on Thursday and distributes it on Friday.In a day they make 13.500lbs of cream, that uses 19000gls of milk.At the creamery there are 50 people who work full time and 110 people who work part time.{RODDAS}say the cream is best eaten within 10 days of purchase. { }
